intro: Bunchosia brevisurcularis, commonly known as the short-leafed bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Bunchosia brevisurcularis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
